PARAGRAPH.STRING: , (Spanish: República Dominicana, IPA [IPA: [re'puβlika domini'kana]]) is a country located on the eastern two-thirds of the Caribbean island of Hispaniola, bordering Haiti. Hispaniola is the second-largest of the Greater Antilles islands, and lies west of Puerto Rico and east of Cuba and Jamaica. A legacy of unsettled, mostly non-representative rule lasted for much of the 20th century; the move towards representative democracy has improved vastly since the death of military dictator Rafael Leónidas Trujillo in 1961. Dominicans sometimes refer to
as Quisqueya, a name for Hispaniola used by indigenous Taíno people.
is not to be confused with Dominica, another Caribbean country.
